people.name: Benjamin Franklin
people.bio: Franklin was a famous statesman, inventor, and scientist who was a founding father of the US. He was a drafter and signer of the Declaration of Independence and he worked with John Jay as a diplomat during the Treaty of Paris negotiations which ended the American Revolutionary War

people.name: Alexander Hamilton
people.bio: Hamilton was another important founding father, an officer during the revolution and the architect of America's financial system. He and John Jay were close friends and worked together often, most notably on the Federalist Papers. Hamilton tragically died in a duel in 1804

people.name: John Adams
people.bio: Adams was the second president of the United States, and was a sort of mentor to John Jay. They shared very similar political views, worked together in congress for many years, and on the Treaty of Paris in 1783

people.name: George Washington
people.bio: Washington is historically America's most important military commander, and was it's first president under the constitution. He and John Jay weren't really friends, but they worked together a lot and Washington made Jay the first ever Cheif Justice of the Supreme Court

people.name: Gilbert Stuart
people.bio: Stuart was the most imporant artist of the early American Republic, as his paintings of Americas founders are iconic. He and John Jay were friends, and it was Jay who introduced him to a lot of important early statesmen

people.name: Sarah Livingston Jay
people.bio: Sarah was John Jay's wife, they were married in 1774 a couple years before the revolution. Sarah was one of the most important socialites of the early republic, often hosting gatherings where important decisions were made. Sadly, she died at the age of 46 not long after John Jay had retired

people.name: William Jay
people.bio: William was John and Sarah's younger son, but he inherited the homestead in Bedford where I work! He was a judge in Westchester county, NY, and was an active abolitionist from the 1830s til the end of his life

people.name: James Jay
people.bio: James Jay was John Jay's brother and he was an accomplished doctor. He's not that famous historically except for creating an inivisible ink formula that was used by spies during the American Revolution
